content: The "Oil Independence, Limiting Subsidies, and Accelerating Vehicle Efficiency (OILSAVE) Act" includes a tax credit for fuel-efficient motor vehicles under section 30D of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "OILSAVE Act" offers a tax credit for new qualified fuel-efficient motor vehicles that meet specific fuel economy requirements. The "OILSAVE Act" provides a tax credit for new fuel-efficient motor vehicles meeting certain criteria, including being acquired for personal use by the taxpayer and manufactured for model years 2009-2011.
